 in	branches/SAMBA_3_0_25/source/lib/replace: . test
body: 7 (return) [ Most probably the palace of the baths, (_Thermarum_,) of which a solid and lofty hall still subsists in the _Rue de la Harpe_. The buildings covered a considerable space of the modern quarter of the university; and the gardens, under the Merovingian kings, communicated with the abbey of St. Germain des Prez. By the injuries of time and the Normans, this ancient palace was reduced, in the twelfth century, to a maze of ruins, whose dark recesses were the scene of licentious love.
